website_summaries.verdict: The PlayStation Classic is a serviceable retro console with 20 mid-90s games, but many of them don't hold up as well as you might have hoped, while other, better ones are conspicuously absent.
pros: The PlayStation Classic packs in 20 games from the original console, including milestones like Metal Gear Solid and Final Fantasy VII
It also includes two controllers, and you can easily save your progress in the games
cons: Most of the original PlayStation games have a difficult time holding up in 2018
The list of included titles feels a bit lacking and we wish Sony included a DualShock controller instead of the analog-less originals
Inexplicably, 9 of the 20 titles are the European versions, meaning they don't run as smoothly on North American TVs

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.text: I had very high hopes for this product... What a let down. For the money I would go out and buy a second hand ps1 and a few hundred games. The frame rate is horrible in most of the games and the selection is a let down.
customer_reviews.author: mickyads92

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't play PlayStation discs
customer_reviews.text: Didn't mention in the product description, but this won't play your old games, only the preloaded ones.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little system
customer_reviews.text: I truly do not understand all the negative reviews of this console. My two friends and I had a great time playing Tekken, Twisted Metal, and Metal Gear Solid tonight. I also did not notice anything unusual (not much slower, if at all) about any of the PAL games I played. They all seemed fine to me. I love the game selection and everything else about this device. The graphics are what I remember from the original PlayStation. Don't listen to the critics and the bad reviews, if you ask me. Thanks, Sony!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, inferior product.
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced, no AC adaptor, and a poor line up of games: 4-5 worth playing. Short cables--it's like they didn't pay attention with the Nintendo releases. Sony tried to jump on the bandwagon of tiny retro consoles, but didn't try to make this worth the cost.

customer_reviews.title: This is rubbish.
customer_reviews.text: Painful to even look at the gameplay. This is complete rubbish. An original PS1 playing on a 19in tube TV would look far better than this. It's truly painful to look at and play.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mama

customer_reviews.title: Only 5 stars with bleemsync hack
customer_reviews.text: The PlayStation Classic has a lot of potential! Not great out of the box because of the lack of good games, but that can be fixed with bleemsync and a compatible USB stick. This has allowed me to customize the console to my likings. For that I give it 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Rossg

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY , very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: this product is a waste of your money,totally not worth $100 ,could of been really amazing, unless your a collector then it makes a good display item, actually cheaper to buy a real Playstaion with better games with the $100
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Lovely
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchasing I did! Thanks Sony for this grateful nostalgia! P.s. if you been born after year 1993 you better keep your money and your opinion for something different. You guys, will not be able to understand what it is and why Sony did it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandr

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and underdeveloped
customer_reviews.text: A very big let down! Not worth the money at all!
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Selection of games is poor. 9 out of the 20 games are the PAL version (they run with imput lag and look slower). No advance or enhancments made (like the NES/SNES Classic). I will be returning mine, is not worth it (for $100 + tax).
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Juarez

customer_reviews.title: Load up your favs... damn shame if you don’t
customer_reviews.text: I don’t get it...stop complaining humans. Its 720p and the pack in games are aiight. But if you are not completely asleep at the wheel, nod nod wink wink... this is BY FAR the simplest system to ‘import’ your favorite games to. Get on U Toob and realize reality. I played 3 hours of Crash Bandicoot 1 and 2 along with Meideval! Stop *itching. Best classic release by far and if anyone is keeping count: The cover of the box gives it away... “Comes preloaded...” meaning please load up your favorites on top of that. Thank you SONY for realizing the peoples just want to play! Take my money, honies.
customer_reviews.author: BGard

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Research more before you buy. The device was extremely small and quality of games was poorer than the original device.
customer_reviews.author: melanie

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I became so nostalgic when I saw this was on the Treasure Truck and I purchased one immediately. I should have read some online reviews first because they were correct. This is a mediocre at best product. These games have not aged well. I lost my interest fairly quickly, but I'll probably give FFVII a go again in a couple of days. Not having a dual shock controller really sucks. I also don't understand why there are loading times... On the brightside, it's an ok paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: This is nothing I've imagined for being an OFFICIAL Product of the franchise.. or is it not??
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to start with.. I don't even know if this is an official product or a knock off but it just looks good and that's about it. The user menu is okay but most importantly the gameplay.. IT LAGS... there are many other systems that can emulate ps1 games better. First game I played is Tekken 3. It's slow and since tekken 3 was not meant for full wide screen tv's it was centered but there were no borders so It almost felt as if you're playing ps1 games on the raspberry pie 3 running retropie. This is the worst emulator you can get to play PS1 games... really... is it an official product??
customer_reviews.author: ZoA

customer_reviews.title: Broken in less than 10 minutes!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with Sony with this product. Went through two of these and did not work longer than 10 minutes!! Save the heart break and pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't include a power adapter,  but it's microUSB powered.
customer_reviews.text: Controller functions barely work in games, graphics don't scale well at all, has no options like Nintendo made in classic nes for modern screen resolutions. The Nintendo classic is worth every dollar for the nostalgia and memories of the original games, but with this ps classic.... stick with 4.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Slow emulator, PAL games, no Dual Shock. WTF Sony?
customer_reviews.text: Awful, awful product. Where do we even begin? - Slow emulator that doesn't run games at full speed. - Uses PAL versions of some games, which run at a slower speed/frame rate, and may also lead to visual glitches due to 60hz conversion on certain monitors. - No Dual Shock controllers means you can't enjoy certain games with analog sticks. Sony completely misrepresented this product by not disclosing the use of PAL versions of the games. They used an emulator known to be slower and more inaccurate than their own in-house emulation solutions. And Sony wants $100 for this? Pass.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: PS1 nice if hackable...
customer_reviews.text: Ok let's be clear... this is not the best mini in the market... is not even close... but lets wait it gets hacked and we may have graphics enhancement and we may even load more of our beloved games into the 16GB on board... this mini is some kind of a bet... black or red... hackable or not hackable...
customer_reviews.author: Luis Romero

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a cash grab. Don’t get suckered in. Don’t waste your money. The SNES mini runs PlayStation games better than this. Sony really dropped the ball on this.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.P

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas present
customer_reviews.text: The PS1 Classic Edition has a great selection of games to pick from great Christmas present.Great games like Twisted Metal,Metal Gear Solid,Wild Arms,Oddworld Abe Oddyssee,Resident Evil Directors Cut,Destruction Derby,Rayman,Final Fantasy 7,Takken 3
customer_reviews.author: Kimball P. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Retro is Back and Better than Ever
customer_reviews.text: Great delivery but Amazon on release date after preorder a month ago. Box looks good. Love Playstation. Great selection of games.
customer_reviews.author: CustomFunko

customer_reviews.title: Limited Selection, Easily Remedied
customer_reviews.text: Let's be real here, it's all about nostalgia. These games can literally be played on your phone, others consoles and even some handhelds. This comes down to nostalgia with this monitor recreation. The System offers 20 classic games you may love our hate, with no intended option to oversee or change these. But, as with any tech; modders come to the rescue. You can now load games from the rear usb port with ease, freeing up the to front USB for two player games. Paired with the 8bitdo adapters you have all the classic titles at your fingertips to relive those memories all over again. At the price point under 40$, it's will worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Strobeck

customer_reviews.title: under rated system, READ BEFORE BUYING
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 PS classics because true blue mini USB stick sold on amazon for $25 that adds 101 more games to the PS classic system!!!! total you can get 121 games on PS classic! :) also $20 8bitdo USB bluetooth adapter allows you to use PS4 controllers, hope this help. worth it.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Very Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I think the only reason it $100 happy the price $75 now is because Sony name on it . I'm very disappointed I pre-order this system right after they talked about it. I din't like the idea it will be only 20 games but, I figured it going to be 20 good #1 games but, no. It doesn't look right and it very slow and some of the games I never heard of and I'm an true 80's baby and girl gamer. I will be returning not worth the money it may drop to $50 soon just wait.
customer_reviews.author: Dria

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I pre-ordered this with the notion that more care in software would go into it. The design is awesome, and so are the controllers. The games chosen and software specs are lack luster considering my original ps1, pc emulator, raspi 3b, odroid, and phone have better software to do the same job. I plan on gutting it to modify for an odroid SBC
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Baker

customer_reviews.title: Better than you think with lots of potential
customer_reviews.text: The reviews for this are a little off base. The included games are not all superstars, but there are some real gems. Regular users will generally not care about some things like the PAL versions of some games or the lack of a true dual shock controller. The system plays well, has 2 included controllers, and with the new lower price point, actually presents a decent value. I like it just as much as the Nintendo classics. This machine has a very easy hack entry so you can customize it if you're a power user. I get why the initial reviews were bad, but they're a little unfair. Give it a try, it's pretty fun.
customer_reviews.author: Matt in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!.. Right in the Nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little console. Great build quality and looks. Really brings in the nostalgia. Bought more like a novelty item but now with a few tweaks out there you can really bring out its full potential. Google “Autobleem” and you’ll see what I’m talking about. Launch pricing was the wrong move, now at under $40 it’s a recommended buy for anyone out there who considers themselves a “gamer” and a Playstation fan as well.
customer_reviews.author: J.R. Justiniano

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Glad I only spent $40. On this. Besides Tekken this is such an awful game selection. Sonu definitely did not win any props on this. Cheaply made controls. Did not even come with a power source. Arrived in a timely manner. Box was beat up, had been tapped back closed. So obviously someone else had this didn't like it and returned it. I can't blame them. SNES and NES classic are by far the better route.
customer_reviews.author: BellaMint

customer_reviews.title: NOT Recommended, get something else
customer_reviews.text: This product is a shame, a lost opportunity, a result of extreme laziness and greed, almost an insult to Sony fans. You better get a SNES mini with Retroarch and play PSX games.... Or even better: get a Raspberry Pi and use this Playstation Classic as a beautiful case for the Pi ... Worst of all, I paid $100 for this and now is heavily discounted. 2 Stars because the case looks very good
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Valencia

customer_reviews.title: I noticed one thing
customer_reviews.text: The bulit quality is naild by Sony but I noticed there is a different between my US Playstation Classic and EU PS Classic,,, My US model when pressed on the front of the case (by the controller plug) I notice the plastic is not supperted from the back it actually could bended back easly but the EU model seems more solid no matter how hard you push on the case corners in.
customer_reviews.author: 90's boy

customer_reviews.title: Had a good taste of nostalgia for me
customer_reviews.text: So far so good it plays really well I haven't noticed any lag. It comes with two controllers a HDMI cable and USB power cord but you'll have to use a spare phone charger as AC adapter and of course the console itself. Honestly I love it I can play metal gear solid, final fantasy 7, syphon filter and rainbow six that's all that matters to me. A good system for those who don't have the space on their PS3 for older PS1 games
customer_reviews.author: Mando37

customer_reviews.title: Classic!
customer_reviews.text: I missed the $20 Prime Day price, but was able to snag it for $30 on Amazon, so that almost as good. Just the USB controllers alone are worth that price, so the whole system was definitely worth it. I was surprised at how easy it is to add games to this system, and now I am loving this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Alan

customer_reviews.title: Only worth it if you modify it, otherwise it’s junk
customer_reviews.text: A great buy if you want to mod it. I love the PS1, but this mini is terrible on its own. First off, the lack of good games is the worst part. You get some gems like FFVII, Jumping Flash, and GTA, but you also get some junk games. Second, the emulation is not perfect. The only true way to enjoy this is modify it. I won’t detail how, but purchase a 128GB Sandisk Cruzer and read how to add your games. It’s worth it only when you mod it. Shame on you Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Locke

customer_reviews.title: Should have been in the $50-$60 range.
customer_reviews.text: Sony missed the mark on this one for sure. I’m returning mine for its inability to play the original discs and it’s inability to download more games, which I didn’t know until it showed up. I would’ve kept it even without those options if they hadn’t charged so dang much for such little versatility. Well worth it if the cost was 40% less. Alas Sony got greedy with an inferior product and judging by the other reviews I’m not the only one disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy T

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for the mods
customer_reviews.text: This was a disaster for Sony when it was released for $99 last year. But, the price has dropped nearly 75% and the mod scene for this is booming. Very easy to get this running retro games with just a usb thumb drive. If you want a stand alone emulation box and don’t want to mess with a retroPI then this is a great solution!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Try it Yourself
customer_reviews.text: I can't understand all the negative reviews. Two controllers, twenty games (which at least half are "pretty good"), all for $50ish? If you loved the original Playstation you cannot go wrong. If you expect great graphics, wrong machine. As for frame rate issues, I've seen nothing and I've looked hard at the games I've played so far. If it's there the blocky polygons aren't showing it!
customer_reviews.author: arcyallen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: The PlayStation Classic is awesome!! Works perfect with autobleem and bleemsync hack. Add all your favorite games. Also works great with wireless PS4 controller. Just add the 8bitdo wireless bluetooth adapter. Update: Also works with RetroArch. It allows you to emulate other gaming systems (i.e. NES, SNES, N64, MAME, etc.) This is awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Herring

customer_reviews.title: Great mini console, when on sale!
customer_reviews.text: If you can find this for $50 or less, it is absolutely worth it. While there are some games that are basically unplayable because of the emulation, like Tekken 3 running at 50hz, all the single player games are great to revisit at that price. Controllers are extremely well made, the console itself looks great, and it has a developing homebrew scene adding even more value to this device. An excellent purchase for Sony fans or people looking for a fun homebrew project to tinker with.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Fel

customer_reviews.title: Very surprised was expecting the worst
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting complete crap and bought it to modify, but not at all. No this was great out of the box and while I see while perfectionist would be whining I was impressed and felt while Sony did a mediocre job of presenting the software that will all change once I use bleemsync. Some drawbacks, the controllers not having vibration, and unable to use other third party controllers to combat that, and while having a USB stick plugged in, can't be on two player games Overall very impressed and a good buy at 50 bucks
customer_reviews.author: M. collins

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfying and disappointed experience
customer_reviews.text: Lackluster gaming device. Bought it, installed the power source and cables and promptly turned on the PlayStation classic thinking I was in for some good and fun times only to be presented with a dismal gaming selection menu. The interface for choosing and going through games seemed unflattering. Playing the preloaded games inside was underwhelming and disappointing as well. Not sure but the video input would keep flickering for me. Not sure if it was the device or something else that was acting defective.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift Idea!
customer_reviews.text: This product came in tact with no damage to the shipping container. When I first opened the box I was amazed at how similar it looks to the classic, just a tad smaller. It comes with 20 of the best games pre-loaded onto it as well. My husband and I were so excited to get it out and play the games. The remotes were working and very well designed. We were able to play for hours on end with no technical issues at all. Very excited to continue buying Sony products!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: What’s up with amazons shipping department?
customer_reviews.text: I knew what I was getting into with the ps classic. Modding it so it will be great but if you want the box or the entire unit as a display piece ...AVOID amazon. See pictures. They don’t even put the system in a box which isn’t smart for people that collect systems. Box labels 3 of them a fixed straight to the systems box and looks like they played kick box with mine. Almost every corner of the box is smashed pretty good. SMH
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worth It for the Memories
customer_reviews.text: Only get this if you want some old memories to come flooding back. There are much better ways to play these games but the ease of use and all in one package is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Niingen

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know where the negative reviews are coming from. This is the same game quality I use to play.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Gray

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment. Got a refund.
customer_reviews.text: Not for ps1 fans. Please do not buy this. Clearly soy rushing and not caring about customers (remember Gran Turismo delays). They are trying to copy the snes Classic. Please go elsewhere for your ps1 fix. I have a psOne with a lcd screen. Much better than this profit mongering move by Sony.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Only Bought Cause Amazon Was Trying to Liquidate
customer_reviews.text: I got this for $40, it now sits on a shelf with its far superior competitors (NES and SNES classic). Planing on getting the 8Bitdo adapter so I can play with my PS4 controller. The games are alright with the D-pad, but that doesn't change the fact that most of the library isn't all that impressive. I would recommend buying this only when it's cheap don't waste your money on it at full price.
customer_reviews.author: Donte

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgia in a PSX shell
customer_reviews.text: While the small selection has a few great titles, the USB expansion port and open software almost begs for software emulation in the form of Steam releases of older PSX titles. Unfortunately, even simply adding expanded memory for its existing selection has proven difficult as a very limited selection of USB flashdrives are actually compatible with its firmware. For the few games it contains, the emulation and action of the controllers is quite smooth and fun. Wireless controller accessories add an ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY range extension to the distance between the screen and where the player sits.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan McKannan

customer_reviews.title: Worth $30, maybe not more.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for $30 so I can't complain too much. It didn't include a lot of games that I love but my kids are enjoying it. Two included controllers is a bonus. Cable length is fair and build quality on the controllers is good. Still, i added USB extensions to make controller cables reach anywhere in the room. The console itself is light and feels a little fragile but not bad. I suggest you take a good look at the list of included games, compare that to the cost and how much you will use it, and think hard before purchasing. This one is really about how much you pay.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: A missed opportunity
customer_reviews.text: The original lineup is ok but with all the hd remasters and ps store re-releases the ps classic suffered. No crash bandicoot or spyro games. No castlevania symphony of the night or twisted metal 2... my reasoning for 3 stars. Just have to wait for a stable hack to come out like with the snes classic and it will be great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Riordan

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with the price drop
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one of these when it first came out. Now just a few weeks later the price dropped 25%. That don't make me happy. I heard all of the complaints about this console and ordered one anyway. I'm not enough of a game nerd that those issues bothered me. I didn't have a PS1 back in the day, and haven't played most of these games. I've got a few PS1 games that I've played on newer PlayStation consoles - but not the 20 games that you get on this classic console. So I'm happy with the console, just not happy having paid more than what it's selling for now.
customer_reviews.author: K. R.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Ok unhacked Great hacked!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not worth the $100 I paid for not being patient. The game library is pretty mediocre when you consider all the better titles they could have put on it. The controller is non dual shock which is a joke. Compared to the Nintendo mini consoles it's a joke. Cosmetics wise it looks great. It's really not as bad as everyone makes it out to be at the current price cuts of $60 and below. The main reason I bought it is to hack it and add more games and emulators and its great for that. I'd only really recommend the ps classic if you know how to hack it which is not hard there are many great tutorials online.
customer_reviews.author: tyler

customer_reviews.title: Not the best games, but over all worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't break the bank and the games are alright. Not to mention it's already super easy to mod the system and put whatever games you want on it. Worth the money in the end, though as is if you don't plan on modding it, there are only a few games that are good.
customer_reviews.author: Ripleyblade

customer_reviews.title: Poor Execution
customer_reviews.text: Jumping on Nintendo's classic, digital systems for a quick money grab is all this is. Playstation had some great games, and included many on this system, but they do not all play like the originals. I find the controls to feel off, and clunkier than the games in the original system. This system is a giant disappoint. It could have been good. It seems as if the whole thing was rushed to production. Poorly executed in every aspect. They cut many corners and it does not come with a wall plug. No outlet plug, how CHEAP!
customer_reviews.author: Adlih

customer_reviews.title: Flexible!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about the things you can do with these, so all i will say is "Don't buy it". I say that because i want the supply to remain high and the price low, so that i can afford to buy them for all of my family and friends.. My only complaint is that this console comes with two classic-type Playstation controllers, WITHOUT analog joysticks. The workaround is of course to purchase a couple of generic USB PS2 controllers separately. Just be aware of this before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Opinionated Steve

customer_reviews.title: So adorable and decent game classic selection.
customer_reviews.text: When I finally received my package and saw the big box, I was amazed at how tiny and cute the ps1 is and how it was modified. The preloaded games brought back memories for me such as Twisted metal, Rayman, Metal gear solid (I played all 5 So this was plus to see it) tekken 3 and so many more. Some games I wish I could swap them out but I probably will buy that crackhead USB later for more options. My daughter plays this ps1 everyday, mini me, I'd be happy if she turns into a gamer like I used to be, it helps with problem solving and stress. Worth every penny please Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Great as a rom box
customer_reviews.text: It plays the stock selection of games okay, but this really shines if you take the time to run custom software on it. When you do the options for this console expand exponentially and it becomes a truly great value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad. But Could've Been Better
customer_reviews.text: I wondered why Sony chose to do PAL games on an NTSC console. In the end this move didn't matter. The games were slow, but still playable. My gripe is the choice of games. Nothing here is familiar with me. No game here really shows why PlayStation was the great system it was. Why didn't Sony include: Final Fantasy VII Final Fantasy IX Gran Turismo Omega Boost Midway Arcade's Greatest Hits Legend of Legaia Valkyrie Profile Madden NFL 99 Soul Blade Darkstalkers Night Warriors Vagrant Story Chrono Cross ...and so many great games?
customer_reviews.author: Barry Strickland

customer_reviews.title: This thing is baddass. Plenty of action already included. Fun to add more.
customer_reviews.text: Fun to add bleemsync. Very easy mod. PlayStation collection is massive and adding and removing them is easy compared to most systems. Love the setup, definitely worth 100- now down to 54? This is a steal. Wish I waited though.
customer_reviews.author: fanaray

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: This review is in no way a reflection of the seller. I got it at a good price and it arriver on time. That being said: this thing is mediocre at best. I feel sorry for the people who got it upon release. It's in no way worth $100. I paid $36 if I remember correctly, and that was too much, in my opinion. The games are a group of "hits" that miss the mark. I've played through MGS.... And that's it. Skip this, you'll thank me.
customer_reviews.author: robert m.

customer_reviews.title: Broken out of the box...
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packaged, brand new, plug in and get "cannot recognize controller" error message...which you need to set it up and actually, you know, play. Tried every combination of unplugging and pushing buttons, looked online and nothing. Included manual said "if controllers not recognized, press reset"...ah, no. And obviously they know this can be a problem to include it in the 2 pieces of advice in the troubleshooting section. Wanted to be a believer as I owned all off the PS models made...but this is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Hiller

customer_reviews.title: Good where I'm at
customer_reviews.text: Don't know what everybody's crying about. Get this and a couple of the true blue minis thumb drives and your set. People complain about any damn thing. No, it doesn't play the discs. But if you're strapped for space this thing is perfect. I can put this in about 600 games (games via thumb drive)in a shoebox. Haven't run across any games that don't work. Pre-loaded on the system or otherwise. Only paid $25 for it. Don't know why the price is jacked up now. Either way, it's still worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great if you plan to mod
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and feel of this little console. It may not have the greatest selection of games but it's solid and at $36 it was probably worth it just for the controllers. I do plan on adding games to this using a thumb drive. I think it's a little weird that it didn't come with a USB adapter. Not a huge deal. Just weird. All of the games should have been NTSC for regions that use that format. It could have been better but I plan on fixing all of that.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Not expensive, but with a few good games.
customer_reviews.text: wasn't enthused with many of the games, but I love the small contour and that USB controllers. I also love Final Fantasy 7, which I basically played the heck out of since I got it. others might like some of the other games, like Tekken or twisted Metal, and that's good, because they are very well represented along with other games on the console. Just having Final fantasy 7 is worth the price and then some. It does not hurt anything at all that it is a quality product I would recommend to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Vern M

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I remember ps1 graphics appearing so much more sharp and crisp as a teenager playing this when it came out. I suppose that could be due to the fact it was the newest system at the time and I had just went from snes to it. This is good for what it is. An easy way to play some favorites from the past. I highly suggest buying a trueblue game back or learning to upload them to a flash stick yourself so that you may play more than 20 games.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Console is 40% off, worth a buy now
customer_reviews.text: For the price of a new PS4 game this console is worth a buy. The real issue with these mini consoles is how short the controller cord is and no way to switch games unless you physically reset the system (without modding). I’d say buy it if your a psone fan or collector, I don’t see the price dropping anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Double Action

customer_reviews.title: STOP COMPLAINING and just get it.
customer_reviews.text: What do you expect this game system from the mid 90s to deliver. Someone had the nerve to complain about the graphics... 🤣... ridiculous... people is PLAYSTATION ... nothing more nothing less... all of a sudden game experts from 25 years ago can tell the difference in quality... 🤦🏻‍♂️ it works great and takes me back to my younger days... I’m seeing game backs on amazon too... might have to get a few... stop comparing it to other consoles because you look dumb... Thanks 🙏🏼
customer_reviews.author: Alberto E. Toribio

customer_reviews.title: you will go far in life having low expectations
customer_reviews.text: I had low expectations after reading reviews for it I bought a Usb flash drive that I can play 8,000 retro games and figured that it would be worth it since the bad reviews for it. I’ve played it stock and I’ve had so much fun and nostalgia with the 20 games it comes with it. People don’t realize that the games ARE what they were when the game came out I remember I’ve played them relentlessly as a kid. Just have low expectations and buy a usb mod to play more games and usb hub.
customer_reviews.author: Darius

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but clunky. Wish it had a few more games. On the plus side the controllers are USB.
customer_reviews.text: a cute retro PS console, The OS is clunky and a little slow, missing a few of the classics Crash Bandacoots, Castlevania, Madden, Tony Hawk, Resident Evil 2. Probably because Sony didn't own the rights to everything for those games. I would have gladly paid extra for a dualshock controller but i'm sure there are third party options out there. Great product, just not on par with the NES, and SNES minis.
customer_reviews.author: M.S. Garand

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost? Maybe...
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with what I have. I'm mad that of the things that I really want to play are not on this. I may try to inker a bit and see if I can mod it, but right now, I think it isn't even worth the $30 that it dropped to. For the record though, now having to buy an overpriced copy of Intelligent Qube and an old PlayStation might be worth the cost of doing business.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Anthoney Cole

customer_reviews.title: Was not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was not happy with this buy. I got it for my daughter she is almost 4 she likes certain games but they just suck, they play fine, and is a good thought, I seen you can get add ons for extra games to play but I didnt try that, im 25 and just didnt care for it either from what i can remember from my actual playstation experience but it works fine and is cheap to play games on. Very easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Johnni

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the reduced price
customer_reviews.text: Great deal at 25 dollars. Arrived in original box, even though it was supposed to be refurbished or open box, it looked new to me and had all manuals and accessories. Playing through FF7 again, worth it just for that.
customer_reviews.author: drdoug99

customer_reviews.title: Good if you customize.
customer_reviews.text: The marketing of this product is a blast to the past. All of those memories and games are very nostalgic to remember, BUT this is not intended to replace the original ps or even compete with it. If interested in giving it a plus and a boost to this console there is many ways you can "UPGRADE" with a software mod. (youtube it).
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Im really liking it
customer_reviews.text: I don't get what so many people dislike about this console, I have genuinely been having a blast with it. the games are fun and its a better deal now.
customer_reviews.author: cjr

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so awesome. Get a wireless controller and the add on game package to make this a five star system. I bought this for 19.99 and got the crackhead usb (101 games for 23 bucks), plus i got a wireless controller and a stackable statoinary usb for an extra 30 bucks. For roughly 75 bucks worth og entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Going Rogue

customer_reviews.title: Best mini console out there!!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best mini consoles out there despite what all the crybaby say on social media! Hackers dream a PS1 Gamers Wonderland!! Everything is easily playable in ntsc in the HD format. not to mention you can add the entire library of PS1 games & multiple emulators to it! Foot in the ass to everybody that wined about this console! It's magnificent!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Its so cute and little. I was concerned about the size cause i already have an xbox360 and a ps4, so i was wondering where i would put it. It was so little when i opened it. It fits perfectly on a small shelf. And im getting the 65gb drive to get 101 games installed. I didnt know i could do that with this station. But i am so excited and i am not disappointed at all.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Abysmal!
customer_reviews.text: To say that this is a disappointing riff on the Playstation would be far too kind. The playability isn't the problem, and the games themselves are a matter of taste. However, the graphics are absolutely distressing. On Twisted Metal, for instance, you can't even see your opponent because the graphics are so poor. Very, very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Pompiere

customer_reviews.title: Fun little device for $20
customer_reviews.text: I realize this had a rough start and the games picked weren't the best and out of region, BUT for $20 and if you hack it and put bleemsync or autobleem with retroarch on it you have an amazing little device that plays anything from the Atari 2600 up to SOME Dreamcast games, it is well worth the 20 bucks I spent on it and I got my money's worth with all of the old games I can play on it using retroarch.
customer_reviews.author: Ira White Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for $20
customer_reviews.text: For $20, this is FANTASTIC. Solid games and included 2 controllers make it a win. For any more, it's iffy. This console is hackable, but it's a pain in the butt to do depending on what you have on hand. If you want to make a retro gaming machine, you're better off learning how to set up a Raspberry Pi with RetroPie - if you need something on super-budget prices, this can fit the bill if it's $20.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B

customer_reviews.title: Very poorly executed job
customer_reviews.text: I hoped this would be the next step in classic gaming given how great the NES and SNES classics have been for me, but this was so poorly executed that it feels like Sony was slapping me in the face. Most of these games are unplayable because the either a poor emulator or inadequate hardware. So far only Final Fantasy VII is playable and still rather poorly. Now I see the price dropped from $100 to $60 which is about the correct market value of this system.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: It's decent especially for the price and you can get it modded to look great
customer_reviews.text: This console isn't bad and it's not great either bad game selection on it if you get it modded it would be a nice system it has the capability of being a real good system the settings on this console are set to low resolution and some pal settings on some of the games you can access the settings to make it look and run better with the 8bitdo Bluetooth adapter for the PlayStation classic mini but every game change you have to go to settings to upsacale the look or change region settings it won't save settings that you can get to with Bluetooth adapter
customer_reviews.author: Tim A.

customer_reviews.title: Nice shopping experience, product looks awesome, but doesn't works very well.
customer_reviews.text: I knew what I was buying, but got a little disappointed anyways, the console and the controls look amazing, and the price was good with great discount, even with all that, playing the games is really hard, some of them feel slow and some cannot be well played with the non-dualshock controller, and there's no options for anything about the games. I recommend buying this only if you plan to hack it, then it improves a little.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Very nostalgic and cool
customer_reviews.text: The PlayStation mini was definitely worth the money for me , the console is on the small side but it doesn’t bother me, the controllers are awesome and everything about this system is very nostalgic , yes it only comes with 20 games however if you look on amazon there are game sticks you can get for this system which will add 100 plus games each !
customer_reviews.author: Kyle L.

customer_reviews.title: Great, if modded.
customer_reviews.text: The games are lacking and Sony decided not to have any DLC to add games. The puzzle games, Mr Driller, FF7, Tekken3 and MGS hold up well, the rest are not so great. Luckily this system is easily modded, just make sure to get the games that are "PS made for PSP". Youtube is your friend for obtaining the info you need to 'fix' this system.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Jurgens

customer_reviews.title: I really got this for the looks, but man do the games stink
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what sony was thinking with this because if you're looking for a nostalgic game player, look elsewhere. The games are NOT the best from the Playstation, and there is only 20 of them. 20? Really? Sadly, this is why piracy is so big. I do not support illegal downloading of roms and such, but I do understand when there's really no other options. Get with it Sony.
customer_reviews.author: J. Giles

customer_reviews.title: Not bad out of the box, minor tweaks make it perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I'll say that like many people I enjoyed a handful of the games that were included, and yet scratched my head at other selections. Twisted Metal is nearly unplayable because without scaling some of the maps are hard to navigate as walls blend in with the rest. Twisted Metal 2 would have been a better choice. BUT, get yourself BleemSync and a USB stick and the world is your oyster. Look it up and you'll see how easy it is to make it the perfect device.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: I modded it already. 😎👌
customer_reviews.text: Nothing short of what I expected. It is a great item for $39.99. I am very pleased with my order. Nice packaging also. BleemSync 1.0 is out. Mod your console so you can play backup files from your old PlayStation 1 CDs.
customer_reviews.author: Tylerd522

customer_reviews.title: Classic but has the wrong titles
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have enough games. One reason is that the ps1 was the first system to have fans of differences in series. Not everyone had a taste for ff7 or rainbow six. Maybe some people loved tenchu over twisted metal. The ps classic is solid, but it is missing something that made the ps1 good in the first place, variety on free choice of games.
customer_reviews.author: B-rad vs wild

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: this is pretty much a pile of junk, but if you can grab one at $25 instead of the original $100 then its not a bad deal. This does have some PAL versions of some games in it so those run a little bad. You dont need my review, everybody already knows (or you can look it up online) that this machine is a failure.
customer_reviews.author: IboughtThisStuff

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgia at it's best.
customer_reviews.text: Wish it had a dual shock controller. The games are fun and a blast from the past but the selection could be better. Overall it's definitely worth the much lower price. Glad I didn't buy it at the $100 price point. I don't notice much difference between the USA and Euro versions. It's been so long since playing the original PSX that it all seems like super old technology at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Mfbc0828

customer_reviews.title: Good price at $20
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I got this for $20 during Prime day, and my star rating is based on $20. If it’s the original $99, i will give it a 2 stars or less. There’s really nothing can go wrong with $20 for this set, comes with two real Sony controllers, and it’s usb and I can use it on computer for retro games. As for the console itself and the games, you need to set it up correctly, for each game, annoying, but works
customer_reviews.author: Jin Huang

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing blast from the past
customer_reviews.text: The console is amazing it has some of the best PlayStation 1 games of all time having a blast playing it everyday! Everything runs smoothly quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Not an acceptable way to ship ANYTHING!
customer_reviews.text: Its very rare that I have an issue with the way Amazon ships something, but when ever I do its usually this exact problem. They just slapped the shipping label directly onto the Playstation and threw it in a truck. Removing the labels just tears the box art which is honestly a big part of an item like this that is meant to invoke nostalgia. Thankfully the system itself is unharmed, but the last time they did this was to a vinyl record and it arrived near split in half.
customer_reviews.author: tracy dennison

customer_reviews.title: It's small...
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the Mini Atari console that I have, the Playstation Classic is much smaller- smaller than I imagined. And I have to use a part of a cell phone charger to get power. Everything that is needed is not included. But the games that I have played so far are fun. The price decreased even more since I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence Myles

customer_reviews.title: I'm giving it a 5 star
customer_reviews.text: The price now is right in my eyes at $39 which is what I bought it for. Vanilla wise as in just playing as it come out of the box. Well at that price it not so bad. It would probably just be a 3 star at that point. Max star review though is when you decided to spice it up. You know what I'm talking about. It make the Sony Classic worthy of purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Syn N.

customer_reviews.title: It's not as bad as people say.
customer_reviews.text: Runs good video is alittle jittery but me and my friends still had a blast. You will need an ac adapter to power the console.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Bad lineup of pre-installed games
customer_reviews.text: In theory this should be a world-class product with an expansive library of PS1 games, however this product falls so short. The library of pre-installed games is laughable. Unless, a firmware update occurs to bring more games this product will lost in a drawer very soon. I know the hacker community has had some success with this product, but from a strictly retail standpoint this product does not measure up.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Fun, simplistic, great games
customer_reviews.text: Fun, like it for $35 & I bought for $15 a USB with 200 + games. Enjoyable, love the simplistic turn it on, play and enjoy. My PS2 & 3, games where one must read the instructions & put to much effort into the enjoyable level to my tastes. Bad part, the frame rate & bit ratio is slow. From research the type of PS1 is the Euro version which causes the frame rate & bit ratio, but still fun.
customer_reviews.author: Scotlcky13

customer_reviews.title: Not as bad as people say
customer_reviews.text: I was in high school when the ps1 came out. My parents got me one for christmas that year and i loved it. I was gonna buy the ps classic no matter how good or bad the reviews just for the nostalgia. After all the bad reviews i was kinda worried,but once i got it i really like it. It doesn't have the greatest selection of games but the ones that are there run good and are fun to play
customer_reviews.author: Chas Gogel

customer_reviews.title: After just a few things this is the best mini console out there.
customer_reviews.text: Just get a usb and look up some stuff and turn this badboy to the best mini console out there.
customer_reviews.author: Hitman173

product_meta.title: PlayStation Classic
product_meta.description:
Introducing PlayStation Classic A miniature recreation of the iconic PlayStation console, pre loaded with 20 fan favorite games along with two wired controllers for local multiplayer showdowns and a virtual memory card for vital game saves. 

PlayStation Classic also features the same famous logo, button layout and outer packaging – but this mini console is approximately 45 percent smaller than the original PlayStation and includes a HDMI cable to connect directly to a TV. 

PlayStation Classic is the perfect console for retro loving fans – and for a new generation wanting to experience the dawn of PlayStation for the first time.
feature_bullets: PlayStation Classic comes with 20 pre loaded games including, Final Fantasy Vll, Jumping Flash, Ridge Racer Type 4, Tekken 3 and Wild Arms
This mini Console is approximately 45 percent smaller than the original PlayStation
Includes two wired Controllers, a virtual memory card and an HDMI cable

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,590 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
